meanings.definition: The physical force exerted on an object.
meanings.sent1: The pressures from the heavy books made the shelf bend.
meanings.sent2: The pressures of the wind against the sail propelled the boat forward.
meanings.sent3: The pressures of the playful puppy knocked over the tower of blocks.
meanings.sent4: The pressures of time can shape mountains and valleys.
meanings.sent5: The pressures of the hammer on the nail drove it deep into the wood.

meanings.definition: The influence or persuasion applied to someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: She felt the pressures of her friends to join the club.
meanings.sent2: The pressures from the advertisements convinced him to buy the product.
meanings.sent3: The pressures of the persuasive speech swayed the audience's opinion.
meanings.sent4: The pressures of peer pressure can lead to both positive and negative outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The pressures of the salesperson made her reconsider her decision.

meanings.definition: The stress or strain experienced in a situation.
meanings.sent1: The pressures of the upcoming exam caused her to study late into the night.
meanings.sent2: Workplace pressures can sometimes lead to burnout if not managed well.
meanings.sent3: The pressures of the traffic jam tested his patience.
meanings.sent4: The pressures of the competition pushed her to perform her best.
meanings.sent5: The pressures of the deadline motivated him to complete the project on time.
